Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Category: COSMETIC AND MEDICAL EQUIPMENT AND IMPLEMENTS
Name: Vase for cosmetics
Description: Stone vase for cosmetics of a flat-based, cylindrical type with slightly flaring walls and a flat and protruding lip. It bears the throne name of a king Neferkare, who could be Pepi II, whose reign terminated the Old Kingdom, or a later ruler. Vases of this type, which are classified as cosmetic implements, contained makeup or unguent.
